items.title: Scientists track the brain-skull transition from dinosaurs to birds
items.summary: The dramatic, dinosaur-to-bird transition that occurred in reptiles millions of years ago was accompanied by profound changes in the skull roof of those animals -- and holds important clues about the way the skull forms in response to changes in the brain -- according to a new study. It is the first time scientists have tracked the link between the brain's development and the roofing bones of the skull.

alternate.title: Scientists track the brain-skull transition from dinosaurs to birds

thumbnail.title: Scientists track the brain-skull transition from dinosaurs to birds

items.title: How openings in Antarctic sea ice affect worldwide climate
items.summary: In a new analysis of climate models, researchers reveal the significant global effects that seemingly anomalous polynyas, or openings in sea ice, can have. Their findings indicate that heat escaping from the ocean through these openings impacts sea and atmospheric temperatures and wind patterns around the globe and even rainfall around the tropics.

alternate.title: How openings in Antarctic sea ice affect worldwide climate

thumbnail.title: How openings in Antarctic sea ice affect worldwide climate

items.title: Brain Composer: 'Thinking' melodies onto a musical score
items.summary: A new brain-computer interface application that allows music to be composed by the power of thought has now been developed by scientists.

alternate.title: Brain Composer: 'Thinking' melodies onto a musical score

thumbnail.title: Brain Composer: 'Thinking' melodies onto a musical score

items.title: Cold region 'tipping point' now inevitable
items.summary: The decline of cold regions called periglacial zones is now inevitable due to climate change, researchers say.

items.title: USA threatened by more frequent flooding
items.summary: The East Coast of the United States is threatened by more frequent flooding in the future. According to this study, the states of Virginia, North Carolina, and South Carolina are most at risk. Their coastal regions are being immersed by up to three millimeters per year -- among other things, due to human intervention.

alternate.title: USA threatened by more frequent flooding

thumbnail.title: USA threatened by more frequent flooding

items.title: Half-a-billion-year-old fossils shed light animal evolution on Earth
items.summary: Scientists have discovered traces of life more than half-a-billion years old that could change the way we think about how all animals evolved on Earth.

alternate.title: Half-a-billion-year-old fossils shed light animal evolution on Earth

thumbnail.title: Half-a-billion-year-old fossils shed light animal evolution on Earth
